item.description: […] I’m a vegetarian, and some places can be challenging as a non-meat eater – carnivorous Namibia is probably the worst! India, Turkey and Thailand all have the most incredible array of vegetarian […]

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/dreaming-of-namibia/#comment-147224">Bryan</a>.
Definitely! I think of Namibia often, even though I haven't been back in a few years. I need to get back to the beautiful Namib soon!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bryan.

Definitely! I think of Namibia often, even though I haven’t been back in a few years. I need to get back to the beautiful Namib soon!

item.title: By: Bryan
item.dc:creator: Bryan
item.description: A great country, like the red sand of KTP once you have had Nam sand in your shoes (Soul) you will always long to return.
item.content:encoded: A great country, like the red sand of KTP once you have had Nam sand in your shoes (Soul) you will always long to return.

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description: Hi Alissa, the best way to travel around Namibia (a massive country) is by renting a car. Both times we drove our car from South Africa to Namibia but you could also fly into Windhoek and rent a car there. Driving is easy and safe, and while lots of roads aren't tarred they are in a very good condition. You don't need to have guides to take you around - just take a decent guidebook and perhaps stay a night or two at a lodge that has guides to take you on nature walks or drives. There are cool day guided tours you can do into the desert with experts on the fascinating flora and fauna. Have an awesome trip!
item.content:encoded: Hi Alissa, the best way to travel around Namibia (a massive country) is by renting a car. Both times we drove our car from South Africa to Namibia but you could also fly into Windhoek and rent a car there. Driving is easy and safe, and while lots of roads aren’t tarred they are in a very good condition. You don’t need to have guides to take you around – just take a decent guidebook and perhaps stay a night or two at a lodge that has guides to take you on nature walks or drives. There are cool day guided tours you can do into the desert with experts on the fascinating flora and fauna. Have an awesome trip!

item.title: By: Alissa
item.dc:creator: Alissa
item.description: Sarah, great photos, I'm sold too! I am planning a trip there and working the details soon - how did you travel there? Did you rent a car or mostly book guides?
item.content:encoded: Sarah, great photos, I’m sold too! I am planning a trip there and working the details soon – how did you travel there? Did you rent a car or mostly book guides?

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/dreaming-of-namibia/#comment-309">Roxanne</a>.
Thanks Roxanne. I know - as soon as I leave Namibia I just want to go back. I haven't been there for two years now so I'm absolutely dying for a trip! I'd love to go far north to Kaokoveld and Damaraland and do an epic 4x4 trip.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Roxanne.

Thanks Roxanne. I know – as soon as I leave Namibia I just want to go back. I haven’t been there for two years now so I’m absolutely dying for a trip! I’d love to go far north to Kaokoveld and Damaraland and do an epic 4×4 trip.
